para: This section provides examples illustrating the basic usage of the client interfaces supported by the RLS. Using the client API, developers may create client applications that interact with the RLS server to perform replica location operations.
Client applications developed in C must do both of the following:

listitem.simpara: Include the client header file at $GLOBUS_LOCATION/include/globus_rls_client.h.
Link to the client shared library at $GLOBUS_LOCATION/lib/libglobus_rls_client_gcc32dbgpthr.

para: For C language example code, click here.
Client applications developed in Java must do all of the following:

listitem.simpara: Include the RLS Jar, $GLOBUS_LOCATION/lib/rls.jar, in the CLASSPATH.
Depend on the client shared library via the Java Native Interface (JNI).

para: For Java language example code, click here.
